findings.risk_title: Lack of Clear Definition of Confidential Information
findings.rationale: The broad definition of Confidential Information may lead to ambiguities and disputes over what constitutes confidential material.
findings.evidence_quote: All non-public information disclosed by either party, including but not limited to technical specifications, business plans, financial data, and customer lists.

findings.rationale: A four-year term for confidentiality may be excessive depending on the nature of the information, potentially leading to unintended obligations.
findings.evidence_quote: This Agreement shall remain in effect for four (4) years from the date of execution.

findings.rationale: Limiting remedies to injunctive relief may not adequately compensate for damages incurred due to a breach.
findings.evidence_quote: The non-breaching party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief.

findings.rationale: The selection of Delaware as the governing law may not be favorable for all parties, potentially impacting dispute resolution.
